definition: to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to drop anchor

sentences.english: A man throws a corpse onto a pile of dead bodies, at the morgue of a hospital in Port-au-Prince.
sentences.chinese: 在太子港一座醫院的停屍處，一名男子拋下一具遺體。

sentences.english: Abandoned by the company, Peter's wife, Alice, must deal with it on her own.
sentences.chinese: 彼得被公司拋下不管，其妻艾莉絲惟有孤軍奮戰。

sentences.english: Idling aways one'slife is like paying gold but buying nothing.
sentences.chinese: 若把一生的光陰虛度，便是拋下黃金未買一物。

sentences.english: The houses were left in haste and all the things were abandoned.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中人們拋下了房子，任何東西都不可以帶走。

sentences.english: And, throw them into the sea from my ship.
sentences.chinese: 疊成一隻一隻很小的船兒，從舟上拋下在海里。

sentences.english: In the story, he had left her stranded in a K-Mart all by herself, while she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 故事中，他拋下懷孕的她孤身一人困在沃爾瑪。

sentences.english: Don't let me down, I need you.
sentences.chinese: 別拋下我不管，我需要你。

sentences.english: Who put the time is wasted, life is behind gold did not buy a thing.
sentences.chinese: 誰把一生的光陰虛度，便是拋下黃金未買一物。

sentences.english: Lalor, steamed away from shore leaving sampans full of Chinese soldiers behind.
sentences.chinese: Lalor下令開船拋下滿載中國士兵的小船。

sentences.english: Presently the sailors lowered the anchor and landed.
They waited for the crew chief to give the signal to throw the rope.
sentences.chinese: 他們等待着乘務長髮出拋下繩索的信號。

sentences.english: She was worried about her Joey but wouldn't leave poor old Wombat.
sentences.chinese: 她很擔心小袋鼠，但又不能拋下老袋熊不管。

sentences.english: Namely, game developers will not completely leave you in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，遊戲開發商並不會完全的拋下你。

sentences.english: After the words, Charles left with his retinues out of Joan.
sentences.chinese: 查理說完，拋下貞德帶領他的侍從走了。

sentences.english: Yes, the fish are hitting the lines as soon as we throw them in.
sentences.chinese: 有，我們剛把釣線拋下，魚就來咬鉤了。

definition: reckless/regardless of everything
to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to follow after/immediately afterwards
to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
without hesitation/resolutely/firmly
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
to blame/to rebuke
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
to toss/to throw out
to stand up
bruised/riddled with scars
to abandon/to desert/to renounce
